body_html:
Its a few comments above: /arch takes only avx and avx2.
sse and sse2 are 'implicit' set for x64 and tensorflow (eigen) assumes sse2 for x64 on msvc.
TensorFlow should be using sse2 already but you still see the warning because the __SSE2__ define is not set by msvc.
Not sure how to fix this the correct way, maybe setting __SSE2__ , __SSE__ in cmake would be ok since everybody is assuming SSE2 is set for x64.
body_text:
Its a few comments above: /arch takes only avx and avx2.
sse and sse2 are 'implicit' set for x64 and tensorflow (eigen) assumes sse2 for x64 on msvc.
TensorFlow should be using sse2 already but you still see the warning because the  __SSE2__  define is not set by msvc.
Not sure how to fix this the correct way, maybe setting   __SSE2__ , __SSE__   in cmake would be ok since everybody is assuming SSE2 is set for x64.
body:
Its a few comments above: /arch takes only avx and avx2. 
sse and sse2 are 'implicit' set for x64 and tensorflow (eigen) assumes sse2 for x64 on msvc.
TensorFlow should be using sse2 already but you still see the warning because the  `__SSE2__ ` define is not set by msvc.
Not sure how to fix this the correct way, maybe setting   `__SSE2__ , __SSE__ `  in cmake would be ok since everybody is assuming SSE2 is set for x64.
